How to Customize a Jekyll Theme

March 10, 2025 • theme, css, customization

Jekyll themes make it easy to get started, but customizing them lets your site stand out.

Step 1: Copy the Theme Files

Run: Copy the theme’s assets into your project so you can modify them.

Step 2: Adjust the Layouts

Layouts live in the _layouts folder. Update the HTML structure to fit your brand.

Step 3: Edit CSS or Add Your Own

Modify assets/css or create a custom stylesheet to override default styles.

Step 4: Add Custom Includes

Use _includes to create reusable components like headers or banners.

Conclusion

With a few tweaks, you can transform a stock Jekyll theme into something uniquely yours.
